metadata.title: CVE-2024-6345 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in the package_index module of pypa/setuptools versions upto 69.1.1 allows for remote code execution via its download functions.These functions, which are used to download packages from URLs provided byusers or retrieved from package index servers, are susceptible to codeinjection. If these functions are exposed to user-controlled inputs, suchas package URLs, they can execute arbitrary commands on the system. Theissue is fixed in version 70.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-6345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pypy-pkg-resources - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
pypy-setuptools - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
python-pkg-resources - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
python-setuptools - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
python3-pkg-resources - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
python3-setuptools - 39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

python-pip - 9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.8+esm4
python-pip-whl - 9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.8+esm4
python3-pip - 9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.8+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-setuptools package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '39.0.1-2ubuntu0.1+esm1').
python-pip package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.0.1-2.3~ubuntu1.18.04.8+esm4').
